meanings.definition: Sour or sharp in taste, resembling vinegar.
meanings.sent1: The acetous lemon made my face pucker.
meanings.sent2: The salad dressing had an acetous flavor.
meanings.sent3: She joked that his acetous expression matched the taste of the vinegar.
meanings.sent4: The acetous remarks stung like a splash of vinegar.
meanings.sent5: The acetous taste was so strong, it felt like my tongue was pickling.

meanings.definition: Having a sour or acidic quality.
meanings.sent1: The acetous apple cider was refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The acetous smell of the pickles filled the room.
meanings.sent3: His acetous wit always kept the conversation lively.
meanings.sent4: The acetous atmosphere in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The acetous sauce added a zing to the dish.

meanings.sent1: The acetous solution was used for cleaning purposes.
meanings.sent2: The acetous fermentation process created a tangy result.
meanings.sent3: The acetous reaction bubbled and fizzed in the beaker.
meanings.sent4: The acetous liquid sizzled as it touched the metal.
meanings.sent5: The acetous content of the vinegar was evident in its sharp smell.
